text: What to do with "The input line is too long" error message?
I am trying to use os.system() to call another program that takes an input and an output file.
The command I use is ~250 characters due to the long folder names.
When I try to call the command, I'm getting an error: The input line is too long.

childList.text: The input line is too long

text: I'm guessing there's a 255 character limit (its built using a C system call, but I couldn't find the limitations on that either).
I tried changing the directory with os.chdir() to reduce the folder trail lengths, but when I try using os.system() with "..\folder\filename" it apparently can't handle relative path names.
Is there any way to get around this limit or get it to recognize relative paths?
